FPS Canine Operations Branch is responsible for the purpose of securing canine explosive training aids. The FPS Canine Program supports utilizes canine law enforcement teams to protect Federal facilities and aid in security and law enforcement efforts. The objective of this effort is to procure Type 2 Outdoor Magazines with a Type 2 Outdoor Cap Box (small magazine), and Type 2 Indoor magazines.

The FPS Training and Professional Development (TPD) Division  has identified a need for administrative support services at the Federal Law Enforcement Training Center (FLETC) in Glynco, GA (Glynco) and the Consolidated Training Center in Alexandria, VA (Bryn Mawr).

NAICS: 541611 - Administrative Management and General Management Consulting Services
Description:
***This requirement will be competed among the 3 Department of Homeland Security (DHS) Specialized Cost Services (SCS) Blanket Purchase Agreement (BPA)***
 
 The Contractor shall provide the US Coast Guard Acquisition Directorate, CG-9283, with cost estimating, cost analysis, database warehouse and data analysis support for any Coast Guard programs on the Major Acquisition Oversight List.  This work shall support the CG-9283 Cost Estimation and Evaluation Branch (CEEB) and may result in the development and submittal of:
  
 ·	Accurate, credible, comprehensive, and well-documented Range of Magnitude (ROM) Cost Estimates
 ·	Accurate, credible, comprehensive, and well-documented Life Cycle Cost Estimate (LCCE) with ACEIT Cost Model and all DHS required documentation.
 ·	Across Program electronic Cost Estimating Baseline Document (eCEBD) Analysis.
 ·	Cost model excursions to answer “what-if” questions and trade-off analyses within and across Programs.
 ·	Tasking or analysis requested by the CG-9283 Office in matters impacting cost, schedule, and performance.
 ·	Management briefing presentations, talking points creation, and materials for project briefs leading to a Coast Guard decision.
 
 The Contractor shall work closely with the CG-9283 CEEB Office, relevant stakeholders, and other U.S. Coast Guard (USCG) offices and directorates to obtain the data necessary to build ACEIT cost models and conduct analyses.  Engagement with external organizations such as similar Department of Defense Program Management Offices or Industry shall be closely coordinated and approved by the Contracting Officer’s Representative.

This will be a ship repair contract for USCGC CUTTERNAME FY23 Dry Dock maintenance availability designed to complete all standard recurring maintenance items: tank cleaning/preservation, repair degraded system components/systems, preserve various hull, freeboard and/or superstructure substrates and replace any degraded metal and/or aluminum portions of the hull/structure. The execution of this contract and following work will take place at the contractor’s facility unless otherwise specified within the solicitation and provided statement of work.
 
 The estimated period of performance start date is 16NOV22 and end date is 22FEB23.

The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) Office of the Chief Information Office (OCIO) has designated DHS OCIO Information Technology Operations (IT Ops), Enterprise Engineering Division (EED) as the Executive Agent for DHS - the Department’s interconnected Wide Area Network (WAN). DHS Homeland Security Enterprise Network (HSEN) (formally known as OneNet) enables the sharing of information across DHS Components, to include shared Internet, intranet, and extranet services. The HSEN Project is responsible for managing the expansion and technical refresh of the DHS HSEN and Redundant Trusted Internet Connection (RTIC) for DHS. This tasking will include Security Engineering & Architecture Support. The security engineering portfolio includes DHS Security Operation Center (SOC) all DHS HQ cybersecurity software tools, sensors, servers, and data storage devices and a malware environment. The contractor is responsible for providing support for the following HSEN services along with Security Engineering & Architecture Support:
 1.)	Maintaining and improving network and network security capabilities to include network modernization and emerging 
         technologies.
 2.)	Providing technical support for the design, build, and upgrade of network and network security systems.
 3.)	Ensuring that the network security architecture is in compliance with security standards and complies with federal and DHS 
         architectural guidelines.
 4.)	Providing network performance engineering and network management support to include network monitoring using the tools 
         and technologies provided by Information Technology Operations (ITO), Enterprise Engineering Division (EED).
 5.)	Ensuring the security tools and infrastructure are available and operational from the perimeter down to the endpoint and data 
         itself.
 The Government envisions the work under this task order to be segmented into three (3) service areas: HSEN Network Architecture Support, HSEN Network Engineering Support, Security Engineering and Architecture Support. The contractor services must comply with DHS and other federally mandated network architecture requirements.
 The Government anticipates using the GSA Highly Adaptive Cybersecurity Services (HACS) MAS,  8(a) Small Business track.

NAICS: 541611 - Administrative Management and General Management Consulting Services
Description: The contractor shall provide all personnel, supervision and other items and services necessary to perform continuous administrative support services for Federal Protective Service Acquisition Division (FPSAD) in Auburn, WA.

The U.S. Coast Guard has a requirement for the purchase of 16 gate valves total manufactured in accordance with MIL-STD-1189(SH) Type 1, Class 4 using specified meeting ASTM B148, alloy 958 for valves 16” and larger.  This purchase is for a quantity of eight (08) each twenty inch gate valves, four (04) each eighteen inch gate valves and four (04) each sixteen inch gate valves.

Contractor requested to provide on-site personnel for the FEMA HQ at 500 C Street, Washington, DC 20472 and locations within national capitol region as defined in this Statement of Objectives. The Contractor shall furnish the necessary personnel, and services (except as otherwise specified). Recommend service continuity are continued with current personnel at FEMA HQ.

NAICS: 315990 - Apparel Accessories and Other Apparel Manufacturing
Description: The United States Coast Guard (USCG), Aviation Logistics Center (ALC), Engineering Services Division (ESD), proposes to enter into a firm-fixed price Blanket Purchase Agreement (BPA) for Laser Eye Protection (LEP), LIT-GX Spectacles for all aircrew members and RX Outserts for those aircrew members wearing prescription glasses.

NAICS: 541611 - Administrative Management and General Management Consulting Services
Contract Vehicle: Program Management, Administrative, Operations (Clerical), and Technical Support Services (PACTS II)
Description:
The requirement is for manpower analysis of technical support services to meet manpower requirement goals for the Coast Guard Cyber Command and additional programs, to be determined by Coast Guard project manager.
 
 The Contractor tasks for manpower requirements analysis technical support include researching, collecting data, modeling, drafting, editing, and documenting during all phases of the USCG manpower requirements determination process, as outlined in the Coast Guard Manpower Requirements Determination Manual, COMDINST M5310.6 (series) and the Coast Guard Manpower Requirements Determination Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures (CGTTP 1-16.15).

NAICS: 237990 - Other Heavy and Civil Engineering Construction
Description:
This is a construction design-and-build project to repair the slopes to the west of the Yuma Annex (Yuma Sector HQ) that have encroached upon Bureau of Land Management (BLM) property and construct approximately 400’ of retaining walls from 2’ to 10’ in height in two to three tiers on the slope.
 
 Acquisition Strategy: This procurement is a proposed 8(a) direct award to GCI construction & Inspections, LLC.

Requirement for IBM Cognos and Maximo software subscription renewals, including maintenance and support services.  IBM Cognos and Maximo software subscriptions and support services to maintain the Electronic Asset Logbook (EAL) and the Decision Support System (DSS) portions of Asset Logistics Management Information System (ALMIS).  As a fully operational steady-state system, ALMIS provides efficient, flexible, and cost-effective operations, logistics, and maintenance support to aviation units.  This software is integrated with other IBM products to maintain requirements traceability for ALMIS subsystems, Coast Guard – Logistics Information Management System (CG-LIMS), and other ALC utilized applications.  IBM ILOG software is utilized to provide long-term heavy maintenance planning for the H60 and H65 helicopters.  The mixed integer programming model serves as a planning tool for maintenance schedulers.  The IBM Cognos/Maximo Software Subscription Renewal, IBM Premium Support Services, and IBM ILOG subscriptions is necessary to ensure ALMIS users of Cognos software continue to receive timely support and maintenance in support of unit mission.

Contractor: Triton Engineering Technology, Inc; Alutiiq Pacific, LLC, Lynxnet, LLC, and Chugach Information Technology, Inc
Description: The objective of this Multiple Award IDIQ 8(a) Set Aside contract is to provide the means for the U.S. Coast Guard (USCG) to procure the services and the ancillary materials required to deploy and sustain C5I systems developed through other contracts. The required support services shall include, but not be limited to, the following: (a) C5I System Documentation Support; (b) C4IT System Installation Support; (c) C4IT System Engineering Change and Time Compliance Technical Order (TCTO) Support; and (d) C5I System Field Support including Preventive, Corrective, and Adaptive Maintenance Support. The services are to be performed aboard USCG vessels/cutters and at USCG shore facilities within the continental United States (CONUS) and at USCG units located outside the continental United States (OCONUS), including Alaska, Hawaii, Guam, Puerto Rico, or Bahrain on an as-needed basis.

NAICS: 532411 - Commercial Air, Rail, and Water Transportation Equipment Rental and Leasing
Description:
:  State of the art training is a critical component to ensuring the safe and effective use of aviation, maritime and riverine operations. AMO has a requirement for the lease of fixed wing aircraft located in the South West Region (SWR) to train CBP law enforcement agents with low flight hours and a commercial pilots license to meet the requirements to become an Air Interdiction Agent (AIA).
 
 Acquisition Strategy: SB set-aside Full and Open competition is anticipated

Anticipated sole source award to the Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM)/Original Integrator (OI). This requirement is for a contractor to furnish all necessary labor, material, services, equipment, supplies, power, accessories, and such other materials as are necessary, to upgrade propulsion control systems on the United States Coast Guard (USCG) 418’ Maritime Security Cutter Large (WMSL) Class of USCG Cutters hulls 750 through 758 and the Training Center Yorktown (TCY) training platform to align all hardware, software, firmware, and project data for the Main Propulsion Diesel Engines (MPDEs), Main Gas Turbine (MGT), Main and Combining Reduction Gearboxes, Controllable Pitch Propeller (CPP) System, and ancillary equipment with the as-delivered configuration on hull 759, in Fiscal Years (FYs) 2022 through 2027.

USCIS has a requirement to buy  Server Hardware and  associated items  to support the needs at  USCIS locations. This is a hardware and associated license buy; there are no installation services required, and all items will be delivered to one location.  Anticipated using FIRSTSOURCE II.

Coast Guard Cutter (CGC) ALEX HALEY Dock Side (DS) Fiscal Year 2023 (FY23): Contractor will be required to perform dock side ship repair including welding, electrical, tank cleaning, ventilation cleaning/repair, steel work, equipment overhaul/repair, insulation renewal, deck preservation, and others in accordance with the Specifications (will be attached with the solicitation). Place of performance is the ship’s homeport located at Kodiak, AK.

USCG Civil Engineering Unit- Juneau has a new construction services requirement (PN 616817) for the 1) Demolition and replacement of a portion of Storis Drive roadway, 2) Repair/Replacement of the water main and service laterals, 3) Repair/Replacement of Sanitary and Storm utilities, and 4) Installation of street plus walking area lighting to increase safety. This project includes reworking the storm drainage patterns to prevent flooding and must comply with current storm drainage requirements. Subsurface contamination is expected. This project requires the appropriate handling, storage, and disposal of contaminated soil. This project is located in Kodiak, Alaska.

Develop M5104, Exercise of Executive Leadership:  Capstone I.  Course will be a 10-week instructor-led online course focusing on providing analysis and interactive opportunities at a strategic executive level that leverage stakeholders, influencer, and actors associated with serving a whole community's public safety and risk management needs. The online course will prepare the students to complete the capstone requirements that will be graded during the 10 day instructor-led course titles R5204 Exercise of Executive Leadership:  Capstone II.

This requirement will be a BPA Call against DHS Language Services BPA.  USCIS has a requirement for Foreign Language Translation Services.  The contractor must provide U.S. based, U.S. citizen translators in multiple languages, including but not limited to Amharic, Arabic, Armenian, Bhutanese, Burmese, Carolinian, Cebuano, Chamorro, Chinese (Simplified), Chinese (Traditional), Dari, Farsi, Filipino, French (Canadian), French (European), French (West African), German, Haitian Creole, Hindi, Hmong, Ilocano, Indonesian, Italian, Japanese, Karen, Korean, Kurdish (Kurmanji), Kurdish (Sorani), Nepalese, Palauan, Polish, Portuguese, Portuguese (Brazilian), Punjabi, Romanian, Russian, Somali, Spanish, Swahili, Tagalog, Tirgrinya, Ukrainian, Urdu, and Vietnamese. The Contractor shall provide the translations in the regional dialect specified by the Government.  The Contractor must recruit and maintain adequate staffing to provide translations as well as editing services by a second qualified linguist.  The Contractor must be able to perform Desktop Publishing to include 508 Compliance, and use a CAT tool for quality control, term bases, and reporting.  All translation must be completed by a certified, college educated human translator and support rush requests with 24 hour turnaround. Requires dedicated project management and an advanced Quality Control Plan.

NAICS: 541611 - Administrative Management and General Management Consulting Services
Description:
The FPS has a need for resources to provide specialized expertise supporting various aspects of the acquisition process. Such support shall include directly assisting the Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) with market research, cost estimating, requirements development, alternatives of analyses, and other acquisition-related documents such as the understanding of software development, fielding, testing, operations and maintenance. A strong understanding of IT network and IT security operations with demonstrated experience leading IT IPTs.  Many of the documents will be used to build complete requirements packages for the contract award process.  In addition, FPS has a need for analytical program support in planning, facilitating, and supporting complex methodology development and evaluation, business process re-engineering, identifying best practices, change management, business process techniques, and organizational development that also may be directly related to the acquisition of products and services.
 
 Vehicle will be solicited via GSA OASIS Pool 1 SB

FORCECOM requires contractor support to provide a wide a range of Information Technology (IT) support, including but not limited to operations and maintenance, applications support and management, Web and SharePoint Services, technical support systems, network administration for standard and non-standard hardware and software workstations and systems, and simulator support.

NAICS: 621111 - Offices of Physicians (except Mental Health Specialists)
Description:
The requirement is to obtain and maintain a TSA Nationwide Network of Medical Services (TSA NNMS) affiliates within twenty-five (25) miles of each airport, for TSO candidates to locally attend Medical and Drug Testing. NNMS affiliates shall be responsible for conducting specified medical examinations, such as physical examinations, color vision testing, distance vision testing, hearing testing, drug specimen collection in accordance with the current TSA Medical and Psychological Guidelines for Transportation Security Officers, inclusive of attachments and updates.   
 
 Provide a secure candidate medical tracking capability that is used during the medical adjudication process to track candidate progress and facilitate evaluation against TSA’s medical guidelines.  Medical records shall be handled/stored/tracked in accordance with current privacy laws and TSA systems and records security requirements and provide Medical Screening Administrative Support.
 
 Provide appropriate medical review of covered employees’ self- certifying electronic medical questionnaires, and, when needed, contact and question employees to obtain necessary information or to initiate the next steps of assessment in order to clear the employee.

The purpose of this anticipated action is to issue an Indefinite Delivery Indefinite Quantity (IDIQ) to provide the Transportation Security Administration engineering support services, though the issuance of Orders under the IDIQ. Engineering support may encompass specific technical knowledge or other subject matter expertise required to address constantly changing security needs in the field as it relates to Transportation Security Equipment (TSE). Such technical and engineering support services may include, but are not limited to: software or hardware improvements, services to support test activities related to configuration management changes that result in system enhancements, and other activities that require knowledge of TSE engineering data to meet TSA requirements.

This contract is to provide technical services for Avionics, Cybersecurity and Aviation Life Support for aircraft sustainment. This would include equipment associated with Tactical, Navigation, Sensors, Communications, Software, Hardware, Information Assurance, Cyber Security and Life Support equipment on board all Coast Guard airframes contract for the replacement of helicopter radar systems to resolve imminent system obsolescence issues and provide airborne weather detection and maritime surface detection capabilities.

NAICS: 334220 - Radio and Television Broadcasting and Wireless Communications Equipment Manufacturing
Description: The U.S. Coast Guard (USCG) is seeking to procure Digital Selective Calling radio systems for use throughout the USCG. This effort is intended to standardize the  VHF-FM Class A DSC radio system. VHF-FM Class A DSC radios may be used at afloat units throughout the USCG as the standard DSC marine radios over the next eight years. This Specification identifies the requirements of the next generation VHF-FM Class A DSC radio system and components that will replace the legacy DSC radio systems. This procurement includes the hardware and software that will be used to maintain and operate the system. System components shall be available on the open market for a minimum of eight years after task order establishment.

The scope of this contract is to provide turnkey hosting and support for a tiered support help desk, systems maintenance, operational enhancements, new development capabilities, and disaster support for the Field Operations Directorate initiatives, security, and compliance requirements for the Deployment Tracking System (DTS).
 
 DTS provides a framework for a robust, dynamic, and an interoperable deployment system. It enables FEMA to identify and deploy the right responders to disaster locations to meet mission needs, enhance communication and collaboration between responders and their command while interoperating with mutual aid, and to support teams and other responding organizations throughout the response and recovery processes more effectively.
 
 The contractor shall support ongoing operations and maintenance (O&M) which includes, but is not limited to, maintaining DTS in a scalable, geo-redundant, cloud-based (Azure) environment, providing the capability for blast communications, push notifications and messaging to the responders, maintaining system compliance, ensuring peak performance of the system, and providing user and training support.
 
 Maintenance and Development will be run through two concurrent modified, agile, sprint processes managed by the Program Office in conjunction with the Contracting Officer Representation. 
 
 Investigations, Operational Enhancements, Disaster Support and Security requirements will be handled on an as needed bases separate from the Sprint Cycle to provide timely and immediate support to the Agency and their stakeholders.

NAICS: 334220 - Radio and Television Broadcasting and Wireless Communications Equipment Manufacturing
Description:
The U.S. Coast Guard (USCG) is seeking to procure Digital Selective Calling radio systems for use throughout the USCG. This effort is intended to
 standardize the s VHF-FM Class D DSC radio systems. VHF-FM Class D DSC radios may be used at afloat units throughout the USCG as the standard DSC
 marine radios over the next eight years. This Specification identifies the requirements of the next generation VHF-FM Class A & D DSC radio systems and
 components that will replace the legacy DSC radio systems. This procurement includes the hardware and software that will be used to maintain and operate the
 system. System components shall be available on the open market for a minimum of eight years after task order establishment.

NAICS: 441228 - Motorcycle, ATV, and All Other Motor Vehicle Dealers
Description: Purchase of up to ten (10) 2022 or newer model year Harley Davidson Police FLHTP (Birch White).
Field Construction Inspector Services at US Coast Guard facilities within State of Alaska.  Requirement has a one-year base period plus four one-year option periods.

NAICS: 541611 - Administrative Management and General Management Consulting Services
Description: The Contractor shall provide management support and technical expertise services to support DHS’s efforts that enhance oversight of the Components’ asset management programs at the Department level, and support initiatives within the Department to increase Unity of Effort through the integration of mission support activities.

USCIS has a requirement for industrial printers to support modernized business processes. These printers will replace current printers that are at the end of their lifecycle and no longer able to be supported by a maintenance agreement after September 2021.   USCIS previously announced this requirement under APFS number 2021055013 but no award was made.  USCIS anticipates awarding this requirement against FIRSTSOURCE II.

The Transportation Security Administration requires continuous human resources, operations personnel action, payroll and benefits support to meet the increased quantities in personnel transactions due to increased hiring surges and external pressures. These services also require an understanding/compliance with statutory merit system principles and prohibited personnel practices as well as the human resource requirements in the Aviation and Transportation Security Act (ATSA), Public Law 107-71 (November 19, 2001). This interim (bridge) contract with Deloitte will allow for a smooth transition to meet increased quantities in personnel transactions due to unexpected attrition, increased hiring, and external pressures.

The U.S. Coast Guard  is seeking to procure sustainment support and engineering services for  the communications suite installed on National Security Cutters (NSC), Fast Response Cutters (FRC),  and Offshore Patrol Cutters (OPC). The specific list of systems to be supported includes the L3HARRIS MarCom® Integrated Voice Communication Systems (IVCS),  L3HARRIS MarCom® Integrated Voice Communication Systems (IVCS) 9.x, L3HARRIS KITE Integrated Terminal, L3HARRIS Radio Base Band Switch (BBS), Coronet TVCS switch, L3HARRIS SYMPHONY® radio control program and infrastructure, and the L3HARRIS SYMPHONY® Next Generation radio control program and infrastructure.  Work is anticipated to be performed where equipment is currently installed including Portsmouth VA, Camden NJ,  Alameda CA, Charleston SC, Miami FL, and Honolulu HI.

NAICS: 336412 - Aircraft Engine and Engine Parts Manufacturing
Description:
A requirement exists for the follow on services by the hour (SBH) contract 70Z03818DB2000016, needed for the HH65E 2C2 Turbine Engine, utilized on the U.S. Coast Guard MH65, Short Range Recovery (SRR) Aircraft. USCG engines are service/agency managed The cage code for all the parts to be serviced is 7Y709, Safran helicopter Engines.  It is anticipated that this will be offered on a Sole Source Basis to the OEM/Prime Contractor, Safran Engines
 
 The solicitation will be a sole source.

Provide professional services including all labor, materials, and equipment necessary to conduct the site investigation/engineering studies, develop Design-Build Request for Proposals (D-B RFP) documents, and provide Construction Contract Support Services and Field Support Services (CCSS/FSS) for the replacement of the wooden boat haulout pier and replacement of the covered mooring for two 47’ Motor Life Boats (MLB’s) that has an enclosed two-story building for work and storage space at USCG Station Tillamook Bay in Garibaldi, OR.  Waterfront improvements include replacement of the wave break and installation of a floating debris boom.

The purchase and installation of a new standalone, Network Video Management System (NVMS), fixed/panoramic/PTZ IP cameras, client workstations, control center flat panel monitors, and all additional equipment and appurtenances necessary for a fully functional IP Video Surveillance System (VSS) .

The Grants Management Modernization (GMM) program office (PMO) is seeking a contractor to provide helpdesk services to support the Grants Technology Division (GTD) Legacy Grants Management Systems (LGMS), the Assistance to Firefighters On-line Grants Management (AFG) System users, the Non-Disaster Grants Management System (ND Grants), and the FEMA Grant Outcome Systems (GO) these services can range from Tier 1 to Tier 2 and be inclusive of system support, grant administration support services, and specific programmatic support to Fire and Preparedness grants. The Contractor will be part of an integrated team, participating with Federal employees and other contractors to support the GTD PMO’s objectives.

NAICS: 334220 - Radio and Television Broadcasting and Wireless Communications Equipment Manufacturing
Description:
This procurement effort supports the purchase of equipment to support CBP’s strategy of enhancing tactical airborne communications with tactical ground units and providing strategic situational awareness for local organizational leadership.
 Acquisition Strategy: TACCOM II - SB.

USCGC HENRY BLAKE (WLM 563) FY23 Dry Dock Availability US Coast Guard Cutter (CGC) HENRY BLAKE (WLM 563) is a 175' oceangoing buoy tender (Keeper class) cutter, currently home-ported in Everett, Washington (WA). Work list will include, but is not limited to: Z-Drive overhaul, Doppler Speed Log replace, Gyrocompass overhaul, Bilge preservation, etc.

The Forms Support Services (FSS) contract provides support to the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS), Office of Intake and Document Production (OIDP), Forms and Requirements Division (FRD) and Innovation and Quality Division (IQ). The FSS supports FRD with the creation and maintenance of USCIS’ public and internal use forms. The FSS supports IQ in pursuing, analyzing, and developing initiatives that enhance efficiency through quality, innovation, and technological solutions. Tasks under the FSS order include: Forms Support, Training, Adobe Experience Manager (AEM) Support, 508 Compliance, and Technology Innovation.  The contractor shall possess extensive knowledge and skills base to train staff on new form design innovations and technologies, and also to create our form products using these new form design innovations and technologies in support of DHS/USCIS.  Extensive knowledge shall be determined by the contractor’s systems and software training with Adobe products and Adobe Certified Expert (ACE) and Adobe Certified Instructor (ACI) certifications.  FRD and IQ requires the contractor to assist with form design tasks using current technologies to meet workload deadlines assigned.  Based on historical data, an estimated 400 forms requests, 100 public forms and 160 internal use forms, and 70 DHS forms, will require the support and service of the provider on a yearly basis.  Services under this order may vary depending upon workload, which is influenced by immigration legislation. Technology Innovation projects are on an as needed basis, currently working on instantiating an AEM environment on-premises with two applications (Fee Calculator, and Where to File), and other projects like developing a secure application that allows for the Reports of Investigation (ROI) being delivered to the intended recipient(s) for the Office of Equal Opportunity and Inclusion (OEOI).  USCIS anticipates to award this requirement as an 8(a) direct award.

NAICS: 541715 - Research and Development in the Physical, Engineering, and Life Sciences (except Nanotechnology and
Description:
Following successful completion of a Phase 4 under DHS Other Transactions Authority, Section 831 of the Homeland Security Act of 2002, as amended (codified at 6 U.S.C. §391), CBP intends to award a non-competitive, non-OTA follow-on to Tamr Government Solutions continuing entity resolution, analytics, and resulting data visualizations work as applied to CBP data.
 
 Acquisition Strategy: SB

NAICS: 541715 - Research and Development in the Physical, Engineering, and Life Sciences (except Nanotechnology and
Description:
To renew four (4) Basic Ordering Agreements (BOAs) with Centers of Excellence (COEs) and to subsequently issue task orders against these BOAs all on a non-competitive basis in support of the Science and Technology Directorate (S&T), Office of University Programs (OUP).
 
 Under the proposed effort, the COEs will continue to stimulate or support homeland security-related research, analysis, and research and development, and technical services (unclassified and classified) to support the various needs and requirements of the DHS components within the COEs respective thrust areas as previously established under the cooperative agreement process through the Grants and Financial Assistance Division (GFAD): Visual Analytics for Command, Control, and Interoperability Environments (VACCINE); Institute for Infectious Animal Diseases (IIAD); Food Protection and Defense Institute (FPDI); National Center for Risk and Economic Analysis of Threats and Emergencies (CREATE).

NAICS: 561422 - Telemarketing Bureaus and Other Contact Centers
Description:
The objective of this Task Order (TO) is for the Contractor to provide a Telephony solution and O&M support for an Avaya Aura Contact Center Elite (CCE) platform, with the use of the Avaya Aura® telephony solution and ongoing technical support, maintenance and consultation services via a telephony Contractor.  Upon purchase DHS shall own all system configuration and access to the PBX software operating system. 
 Applications Supported:
 1.	Voice Agents.
 2.	Supervisors.
 3.	Call Recording.
 4.	Avaya Aura Experience Portal (AAEP).
 5.	Call Management System (CMS).
 6.	Dynamic Self Service (DSS).
 7.	Call Back Assist (CBA).
 8.	Inova Display Boards and Marquee (software support of Avaya data and reporting) 
 The scope of this requirement ensures the Contact Center platform is fully installed and operational for the life of the TO.

Contractor: John Hopkins University Applied Physics Lab
Description:
Contract will serve to continue the technological updates required for Customs and Border Protection(CBP) Air and Marine Operations(AMO) to remain relevant with the rapidly improving technological changes in airborne sensors, processing capabilities and sensor data dissemination. John Hopkins University Applied Physics Lab (JHU/APL) has a long history with AMO in providing rapid reaction and prototyping activities that have procured technologies that enhance AMO operational imperatives and existing capabilities for successful mission execution.
 
 Acquisition Strategy: The requirement is a follow-on Sole Source Contract.

PN18609005 - Design Services for Repair Piers at SEC Delaware Bay
 
 The project is to investigate, design and coordinate the maintenance repairs of the main pier, fendering system, and tug floating dock at Coast Guard Sector Delaware Bay, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.  Submission of plans, specifications, and estimates at various stages of design will be required as deliverables

NAICS: 423430 - Computer and Computer Peripheral Equipment and Software Merchant Wholesalers
Description: The United States Secret Service (USSS) Office of Chief Information Officer (OCIO) has a requirement to renew Enterprise Tableau Software Licenses and support. Tableau is a business intelligence platform that supports the entire analytics cycle, from discovery to operationalization. Visualize, analyze, and share actionable insights about your data with anyone in your organization. The Tableau software Business Intelligence (BI) suite is an underlying component required to run investigative reports including counterfeit, electronic crimes, incident case reporting, various Management and Organization Division (MNO) reports, Human Resources (HR) reports and HR Quality Assurance reporting. Tableau is an enterprise BI tool used for Enterprise level reporting and business analytics.

This requirement is a follow-on to continue the framework for the provision of HSPD-12 Executive Premier Maintenance to support Government-owned Enrollment Issuance Workstations (EIWS) and servers, 24 hours a day, seven days a week for software/hardware technical support and replacement of Government-owned EIWS, Identity Management System (IDMS)/ Credential Management System (CMS) servers, Hardware Security Module (HSM) servers and related equipment.

NAICS: 541611 - Administrative Management and General Management Consulting Services
Description: The Federal Protective Service (FPS) has a need to acquire specialized expertise to directly support the Financial Operations (FMO) of FPS with financial, revenue, and accounting, budgeting, and other analytical activities considered mission critical. FPS will be seeking approximately twenty-three (23) contracted staff consisting of the following types of services: (1) Program Manager, (1) Senior Financial Analyst, (3) Journeyman Financial Analyst, (5) Junior Financial Analyst, (1) Senior Financial Systems Analyst, (1) Journeyman Financial Systems Analyst, (2) Senior Budget Analyst, (2) Journeyman Budget Analyst, (3) Junior Budget Analyst and (4) Journeyman Accountant. In addition, twelve (12) surge optional: (1)Senior Financial Systems Analyst, (1) Journeyman Financial Systems Analyst, (3) Junior Financial Systems Analyst, (1) Senior Financial Systems Analyst, (1) Budget Analyst, (1) Journeyman Budget Analyst, (2) Junior Budget Analyst, (2)  Journeyman Accountant.

The U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) Office of Field Operations (OFO) San Diego Field Office has an ongoing requirement for armored vehicle courier services along the southern California border.  The contractor shall provide all supervision, personnel, equipment, labor, bonding, insurance, licenses, permits and supplies necessary to perform Armored Vehicle Courier Services for the CBP Southern California Border Crossings and Ports of Entries. These services require the contractor to pick-up and deliver sealed deposit bags of currency of varying value.  There are currently five (5) pickup locations.  Deliveries shall be made to federally approved cash vault(s) within the area of operation.  Deposit location(s) shall be provided by the Contractor and coordinated/approved by the Government at contract award.
 
 Acquisition Strategy: Large Business

NAICS: 541611 - Administrative Management and General Management Consulting Services
Description: Contractor support services to assist CISA in operating a fully functional gTLD registry, including website management and administration, .gov helpdesk support and domain management, and system security.

The scope of this anticipated contract is to support the Office of the Chief Information Officer (OCIO).  To acquire the products and execution requirements relating to furnishing and installing the voice telecommunications system. Product specifications, general design considerations, and installation guidelines will be provided. Support required; consists of furnishing all labor, equipment, materials, supplies and performing all operations necessary to complete the installation of this voice telecommunications system in compliance with the specifications and drawings that will be provided. Support required to furnish, install, and test a new VoIP phone and voicemail system to support DHS/ICE operational requirements. Provide support to allow the installation of the entire system and certified technician on site for the complete installation and move.

Federal Protective Service (FPS) Region 4 program office has a need for continued Protective Security Officer (PSO) services throughout the state of North Carolina for 64 buildings. FEMA, Disaster Support Branch seeks to award a multiple award IDIQ contract for contractor services to provide turn-key temporary facility solutions with all-inclusive amenities for responders, other authorized personnel, and assets deployed for occurrences, or events, requiring a Federal Government response in CONUS and OCONUS locations, including U.S. States, territories and commonwealths. 
 The Contractor shall provide all necessary labor, supervision, equipment, tools, materials, fuel, supplies and transportation necessary to provide the items and services in support of this requirement. The Contractor shall house all authorized responders in facilities with, but not limited to, tents with leveled matted floors (or equivalent with permission), plywood floors (or equivalent), modular units, or other solutions such as barges, ships or other means capable of meeting all applicable design loads for wind, snow, seismic, flood, extreme temperatures, extreme humidity, and other potential hazards. All housing solutions shall be equipped with heating and air conditioning (HVAC) to meet all environmental conditions and capability of maintaining the interior temperature between 68 and 72 degrees Fahrenheit as well as providing bedding, meal services, kitchen, dining hall, limited recreation facilities, operations center, medical unit, refrigerated trucks, shower units, hand wash units, potable (drinking) water, water purification and manifold distribution systems, toilets, on-site manifold distribution of black and grey water and associated on-site sanitation systems, complete laundry service, trash removal and dumpster service, industrial generators, light towers, identification cards, fencing and barricades.

NAICS: 541990 - All Other Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services
Description: Requirement Provide 168 hours a week for 52 weeks a year common operational picture (COP) watch stander support for the United States Coast Guard located at the Atlantic Area Command Center in Portsmouth, VA. Examples of contractor tasks include providing 168 hours a week COP Manager support, scheduling, technical support, documentation management, just-in time training, database support, briefing support and other tasks directly associated with supporting a COP for the USCG. Program Description Operational Commanders are required to have a robust command and control system which will provide them with the capability to produce and/or contribute to, evaluate, display, and disseminate the USCG's Common Operating Picture (COP); a near-real-time depiction of the tactical situation. The COP will enable Maritime Domain Awareness and act as a decision-making tool for the Area, District, and Sector Commanders by allowing the exchange and display of mission essential data, including asset, threat, and high interest vessel information as well as other data elements, including geographical overlays. To achieve this goal, the USCG Office of Command, Control, Communications, Computers (C4) and Sensor Capabilities (CG-761) has designated the Global Command and Control System - Joint GCCS-J to serve as the command and control system and to act as the foundation for the ashore command and control (C2) architecture. The Global Command and Control System (GCCS) has been deployed to all Area, District, and Sector command centers and is the primary tool in developing the COP. It integrates disparate data source and fuses it with information gained through local and national sensors to produce a near-real-time depiction of the overall operational picture within a specified geographic region. The USCG's ashore command and control information exchange is based on a Common Operational Picture Synchronization Tools (CST) environment. USCG TOPCOP located at Atlantic Area (LANTAREA) Command Center is the primary data exchange point for Department of Defense (DOD) partners. The TOPCOP is designated as the controlling node for the Coast Guard COP. All District level command centers are equipped with GCCS and contribute site-specific information to the COP as well as assist the TOPCOP in the correlation and fusion of data as required for developing a complete operational picture.

AMO operates a mixed fleet of high-speed enclosed cabin interceptor vessels. Some of these vessels are approaching the end of their service life. To maintain operational viability and to standardize the fleet, CBP intends to procure up to 20 new 38’ enclosed cabin interceptor vessels. 
 The contractor shall have total program responsibility for ensuring that the requirements in this SOW are met. The contractor shall provide program management, engineering, procurement, fabrication, manufacturing, and testing of all modifications for the vessel. All standard factory equipment shall be of the manufacturer’s commercial model, unless otherwise noted, and shall be provided as specified herein. 
 
 Enclosed vessels are specifically used in environments where inclement weather exists for a large portion of the year, and are referred to as All Weather Interceptors (AWI). Typical missions include patrol, interdiction, special operations, and port security support. AWI are used to pursue suspect vessels for the purpose of boarding, searching, and when necessary, arresting violators and seizing the vessel and/or contraband.  AWI perform tactical and interdiction operations that include high speed maneuvers and turns in close proximity of another vessel. Operations typically consist of a three-person crew; however, at certain times, AWI may be operated with a four-person crew. 
 AMO intends to retire aging 33’ AWI within the fleet and to procure new 38’ vessels with trailers to replace them. To meet CBP operational requirements, the contractor shall design, build, integrate, test, and deliver vessels in accordance with the AWI Performance Specification. All structural design and construction shall be accomplished in accordance with the contractor’s technical drawings and documents. All material and equipment for the construction and outfitting of the vessel shall be new. The contractor shall be responsible for procuring and safeguarding the materials and components, less any Government Furnished Equipment (GFE) necessary to construct and equip the vessel. The contractor shall also be responsible for procuring any tooling, test equipment and contractor-furnished equipment (CFE) necessary for ensuring completion as outlined by this SOW. To reduce costs and enhance equipment availability and support, the contractor shall utilize "commercial, off the shelf" equipment to the maximum extent possible.
 
 
 Acquisition Strategy : Large Business

NAICS: 541990 - All Other Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services
Description: The Office of Program Accountability and Risk Management (PARM) Acquisition Workforce Staffing Division( AWSD) is in the process of developing a DHS Acquisition Staffing model to show the ideal number and type of staff needed for DHS Acquisition Programs.  A prototype has been developed over the course of 2020-2021 in partnership with PARM, component stakeholders, and PA&E utilizing their existing modeling BPA contract vehicle to acquire SME support.  The prototype model works by structuring all DHS MAOL 1&2 level acquisition work into a task list / WBS of fewer than 60 major acquisition tasks, identifying which programs completed which tasks in the base year of 2020 and plan to complete in the next year of 2021, estimating the ratio of FTE from the annual staffing plan allocated to each worked task, and ultimately crafting a model that shows how programs are over / understaffed.  The prototype will be iteratively improved through continued feedback with component stakeholders, and updates regularly published to the DHS Mobius hosting site.  Once completed, the model will allow improved predictive analytics related to the ideal number and type of FTE needed to successfully deploy major programs at DHS.

USBP RGV Sector has a requirement for Hazardous Material / Contraband Extraction services at two of its checkpoints.  USBP RGV Sector is responsible for the operation of two Checkpoints where vehicles traveling north are subject to inspection for illegal narcotics (contraband). Past history has shown that contraband may be hidden in conveyances transporting materials considered hazardous.  CBP agents do not have the expertise or training to safely extract the contraband, which in it-self can be considered hazardous, or decontaminate it for future use as evidence in legal proceeding.  The contraband has to be extracted and decontaminated on site under the supervision of CBP agents who will take control of all contraband once the extraction and decontamination process is completed.

 The Krome SPC is a government owned and operated detention facility. The facility is a comparable size to a community college campus and occupied by federal government employees and detainees operated on twenty-four (24) hours a day, seven (7) days a week, 365 days a year basis.
 There are seventeen (17) building assets totaling (132,947) gross square feet (GSF) and a total of 112 acres, of which 49 acres are improved for mowing, 10 acres unimproved for mowing, total grounds to be policed (maintained), and 2 acres of flower beds, and trees trimmed when needed.

The Contractor shall provide management, supervision, labor, materials, equipment, and supplies and shall be responsible for the efficient, effective, economical, and satisfactory operation, scheduled and unscheduled maintenance, repair of equipment and systems, including vertical transportation, pest control, solid waste removal and recycling program, air quality control permits, hazardous and medical waste removal, telephone communications/programming, surveillance systems, welding, water testing, and all related services located within the property line of the following locations:
 
 Aguadilla Service Processing Center (Only O&M apply to this facility)
 The Aguadilla SPC facility is located in Aguadilla, Puerto Rico. It is situated on approximately 3 acres. There are 4 building assets totaling approximately 16,500 gross square feet (GSF), and 8 structure assets located on the site. The following is the infrastructure for this facility:1) Administration Building, 2) Service Processing Center, 3) Butler Building, 4) All green areas, 5) Generators and Diesel Tanks and 6) New Warehouse.
 
 Vieques Communication Facility (Monte Pirata Communications)
 The Monte Pirata Communications Facility is located on the island of Vieques, Puerto Rico. This is a structural asset which occupies less than an acre and consists of the following exterior items: 1) Microwave communications antenna tower,  2) Several small equipment shelters, 3) Generator building, 4) Water tank, 5) Electrical closet, 6) Air conditioning units, 7) Above ground Diesel Storage Tank, 8) Transformer Station.NOTE: Services at this location are limited to the following: 1-	Pest Control; Cut grass (every other week); maintain mini-split AC unit (no big HVAC); recycling/disposal program; touch up paint on doors, windows and walls; ensure walls and surfaces are clear of surface rust; rust mitigation. 2-	The labor category anticipated at this location to perform the aforementioned services is a General Maintenance Worker – visit the site twice per week (average of 20 hours per week of work); Onsite Response time requirement is within 15 minutes of notification. 3-	The contractor shall utilize an employee who lives on Vieques Island and can respond to emergency calls within 15 minutes and be on the jobsite within 30 minutes after initial response to the emergency service call.
 
 Antilles ICE Facility
 The Antilles site is a Government Owned Facility located at 400 Av. Manuel Fernandez Juncos. It is situated on approximately 3 acres.   There are 5 buildings that belong to ICE located within the fenced area. The building assets total approximately 44,564 gross square feet (GSF): Building #1- Main Building; Building #2- Conference Building; Building #3- Warehouse; Building #4- Generator Building and Building #5- Guard Shack.

The Contractor shall provide management, supervision, labor, materials, equipment, and supplies and shall be responsible for the efficient, effective, economical, and satisfactory operation, scheduled and unscheduled maintenance, repair of equipment and systems, including vertical transportation, pest control, solid waste removal and recycling program, air quality control permits, hazardous and medical waste removal, telephone communications/programming, surveillance systems, welding, water testing, and all related services located within the property line of the following locations:
 - Saint Thomas ICE Facility
 The Saint (St.) Thomas ICE facility is a group of buildings which support ICE Operations located on Crown Mountain. The address is: Crown Mountain Radar Site, St. Thomas, US Virgin Island 00802. The site occupies 27 acres. The provision of services will be required for all habitable buildings on the site to include 2 buildings that facilitates holding detainees temporarily for processing; the sum total of square footage for all buildings is approximately 1,000 square feet.
 NOTE: The Janitorial services will be included in this facility.
 The following is the infrastructure for this facility:1) Communications tower, 2) Guard shack,3) Building 2804 (to include Holding/Interviewing Rooms), 4) Generator room, 5) Modular building (to include 3 Holding Cells), 6) Septic System, 7) Above ground water storage tank, and 8) Below ground diesel storage tank.
 St. Croix ICE Facility
 The St. Croix ICE facility is a group of buildings which support the ICE Operations located on St. George’s Hill. The address is: St. George’s Hill Radar Site, St. Croix, USVI. 00820. The site occupies 8 acres. The provision of services will be required for all habitable buildings on the site to include 1 building that facilitates holding detainees temporarily for processing; the sum total of square footage for all buildings is approximately 6,000 square feet.

 USCIS has a requirement for Cyber Security Support Services (CSSS). The CSSS-Operations contractor will have a primary responsibility to provide the ability to identify, protect, detect, respond, and recover from cybersecurity threats and incidents.  This ability will require highly specialized skill sets with significant experience and the ability to provide ongoing best practices.  The limited number of available Government staff with these skill sets make it essential to find commercial sources to supply these services.  Commercial sources should also able to provide cutting edge cybersecurity industry best practices.  The contracted services will be required for the foreseeable future and a three year period of performance is anticipated.

Contract Vehicle: Technical Investigative Surveillance Equipment II (TechOps II)
Description:
CBP needs to install an electric fence with access control and intrusion detection systems that comply with CBP electronic security requirements.  The goal of this project is that the installation of an electric fence system will greatly reduce the number of attempted break-ins and reduce the risk from its current state of medium to low.  The electric fence MUST be solar powered. This must be a standalone system and cannot be tied into the current facilities infrastructure.
 
 System upgrade will also include new card readers or keypads. 
 
 The electric fence would need to secure the perimeter of 5,525 linear feet, two (2) gate(s) and cellular unit(s) for communication. The system will include all basic necessary components such as the electric fence controller(s), batteries, solar panels, virtual system access, multi-lingual warning signs, keypads, and alarm panel(s).
 
 The electric fence needs to be 10 feet high placed several feet inside the perimeter fence so that no person walking by can accidentally touch it. Solar Powered electric fence will need to be in place for seven years and price must include all maintenance and repairs.  The contractor will provide 24/7/365 monitoring and notify police (911) when alarms are triggered.  The contractor will also provide alarm notification to CBP personnel as identified at award.
 
 These security upgrades are essential for safeguarding these vehicles that are being held as evidence for court cases. The number one priority is keeping all these vehicles safe while in custody.
 
 Acquisition Strategy:  This is a Sole Source requirement. Only one vendor provides the Electric Guard Dog Solar Powered Fence required by CBP to protect the Seized and Forfeited Property Center (SFPC) at the Government Owned Contractor Operated (GOCO) in San Diego, CA.

This requirement is to procure AWBS software sustainment to include software upgrades and maintenance, software training, software server hosting services, and software help desk support as well as upgrade and sustain the current C-130 AFF, and design, develop, field and sustain new software AFF’s for the USCG’s other aircraft platforms.

The Contractor shall ensure the AWBS software incorporates the latest Technical Order for each USCG aircraft platform.  The AWBS software shall incorporate each aircraft configuration and any new or modified software and hardware technologies to increase effectiveness and performance of the software.

 USBP's Asset Forfeiture Program is a nationwide law enforcement program that has proven to be an effective and powerful strategy in the fight against crime.  The AFP promotes the disruption and dismantling of Transnational Criminal Organizations through the use of civil and criminal forfeiture, helping safeguard the nation’s borders.   This is accomplished by removing the proceeds of crime and other assets relied upon by criminals and their associates to perpetuate their criminal activity against society.

NAICS: 541611 - Administrative Management and General Management Consulting Services
Description: President Biden directed the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) to lead implementation of ongoing efforts across the federal government to support vulnerable Afghans, including those who worked alongside us in Afghanistan for the past two decades, as they safely resettle in the United States. These coordinated efforts are known as Operation Allies Welcome (OAW). To support the coordination effort, DHS has stood up a Unified Coordination Group (UCG) to coordinate efforts under OAW. The work of the UCG is undertaken in close collaboration with partners in state and local government, non-governmental organizations, and the private sector. The requirements represented within this APFS record include contractor support to assist the UCG and associated Federal Coordination team by providing a variety of services to include administrative assistance, planning, resource and data analysis capabilities, as well as communications capabilities through September 2022 in Maryland and Virginia.

The contractor shall provide comprehensive systems and software engineering, program management, technical, and analytical T&E support services to the Department of Homeland Security, Customs and Border Protection, Operations Support (OS) Land Systems Operational Test Authority (LSOTA) performing Operational Test and Evaluation of new and existing DHS/CBP acquisition programs, projects and systems. The contractor shall also provide full spectrum software engineering support for process improvement at the organizational level. This SOW describes the forms of the support needed.
 
 Contractor will provide technical and analytical support to LSOTA in the definition, conduct, and analysis of structured OT&E of CBP systems.  This support will be required in one or more of the following forms:  Documentation Review, Operational Test Design, Test Execution, Data Management, Test Planning Support, Test Operations Support, Test Analysis and Reporting, Modeling and Simulation Support, and Program Management Support.  LSOTA is charged with leading the operational test community with highly skilled testers and staff that adapt to change, and provide credible, prompt, mission-focused test results to CBP, and DHS acquisition leadership.
 
 Acquisition Strategy: This is a follow-on contract to replace the incumbent 8(a) contractor. The acquisition strategy is to award a sole source contract under the 8(a) program.

NAICS: 541611 - Administrative Management and General Management Consulting Services
Description:
The Coast Guard (CG) Surface Acquisitions Logistics Center (SALC) requires administrative support assistance to aid in the day-to-day functions of the organization.  The SALC is a dedicated organization within the Coast Guard that provides Life Cycle Logistics, Program Management, Test and Evaluation, Shore Infrastructure, Maritime, Command, Control, Communications, Computer Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance and Systems Engineering support to new surface assets.  The SALC specializes in preparing assets for transition from acquisition to sustainment logistics support safely and effectively, with minimal impact on the operators and maintainers in the field. 
 
 To conduct this effort, the Contractor shall provide qualified staff capable of performing administrative & office duties as required such as Front Desk reception, operate various IT systems, provide training & basic IT trouble shooting, work as a team, prepare written correspondence & presentations, and others listed in this SOW.

NAICS: 541611 - Administrative Management and General Management Consulting Services
Description: The Contractor shall provide program management and subject matter expertise that will support long-term (ICE) Office of Budget and Program Performance (OBPP) program-specific initiatives to advance data-driven decision making across all levels of leadership. The Contractor will be expected to use SharePoint, Tableau, Tableau Server, R, R Studio, Excel, and all Microsoft Office Suite® tools (current and future agency versions) to generate products and tools for review and implementation. ICE OBPP is looking to increase data-driven decision making across the enterprise by continuing the development of analytical management tools and integrating those tools into budget operations. Contractor shall support OBPP for these long-term initiatives, as well as supporting workload staffing, cost modeling, Tableau Server administration, spend planning, performance, and program outreach. OBPP may require additional support from the Contractor in the areas of Evaluation, Analytics, and Automation in the performance of this endeavor.

 Acquisition Strategy: Intend to solicit to Women Owned Small Business.

The Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) shall use a local Security Company to provide all personnel, equipment and vehicles required to provide Security Services at the group sites.

The Contractor shall furnish all contract oversight management, labor, equipment, tools, and supplies necessary to maintain complete and fully functional vehicle barrier systems. The Contractor shall furnish preventive and corrective maintenance and repair services on 60 barrier systems including electrically actuated gates, wedge barriers and hydraulic bollards.  
 To keep the barriers in operational condition, preventative and corrective maintenance are required.  Preventative maintenance includes annual check-out and operational test of each barrier.  Because of the critically of these barriers, any corrective maintenance requires a two-hour response time from notification to technician arrival.

These services need to be marked and provisioned as Government Law Enforcement with first responder priority.  The plan should give the user preferred access to network resources.  The dedicated core shall provide end to end network encryption and be interoperable with other Federal, State and Local agencies.

This complete Pest Control services will be done on a continuing basis throughout the period of performance.  A base year will be awarded with four optional years that may or may not be awarded to the contractor.  
 Independently and not as an agent of the government, the contractor shall provide all the needed services, labor, qualified personnel, travel, equipment, and material, to perform prompt, complete, comprehensive pest control of and for the Laredo Sector Facilities named below and the K-9 Living Areas at Agents Residences.  The contractor shall be responsible for selecting personnel who are well qualified to perform the requirements of this task and meet all governmental requirements, such as license and any other needed skills knowledge and abilities.  The contractor will supervise techniques in their work, keep them informed of all changes and methods of operation.  Contractor personnel shall conform to all Government regulations that may be in effect during the period of performance.
 
 Acquisition Strategy:  Anticipate GSA small business woman owned.

NAICS: 518210 - Data Processing, Hosting, and Related Services
Description:
The purpose of this procurement is to obtain Subject Matter Expert support for IT hardware update and maintenance.  
 The SME skill set shall consist of the following:
 
 •               Expertise at managing and configuring Nutanix Prism software.  Duties shall include site to site data replication and failover configuration within the software product.
 •               Expertise at managing and configuring Nutanix Acropolis File services.  Duties shall include configuring and presenting AFS devices for 3rd party software/OS access.
 •               Design, implementation, and integration services for Nutanix/VMware.
 •               Administration and support of Nutanix/VMware environment.
 •               Perform capacity planning and architectural strategy support.
 •               Serve as trusted advisor to USSS infrastructure team providing guidance as well as Nutanix and VMware best practices.
 •               Identify and suggest architectural and engineering changes.
 •               Training and enablement of customer resources.
 •               Proficiencies with VMware ESX/vSphere, Horizon, and Microsoft Hyper-V. 
 •               Nutanix NPP certification.
 
 The requirement includes On-Site and telework SME support.  The location of the work is the Metropolitan DC area, and requires personnel located in the area (within 60 miles).  The period of performance shall be one year for SME support for 40 hours per week with 2 option years exercisable for SME support at the discretion of the USSS.

The contractor shall provide Garrison Secure Web Browsing Support and on-site system administrators to complete specific projects, supplement capabilities, or perform system planning analysis and management as required on installed operational platforms.

NAICS: 336413 - Other Aircraft Parts and Auxiliary Equipment Manufacturing
Description:
A requirement exists for the purchase of Pilot and Co-Pilot seat parts for the United States Coast Guard, Short Range Recovery (SRR), MH65 Aircraft.  The purposes of these parts are to support the continued maintenance of the Fleet and the PDM Line.  All the items have an Acquisition Method Code (AMC) of 3 meaning the parts shall be acquired directly from the Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) and/or an AMC of 5 meaning the parts shall be acquired only from the prime contractor.
 
 The solicitation number is 70Z03822RB2000009 and it will be a sole source requirement.

The purchase of the BMC TrueSight Suite includes the hardware and software licenses to deploy the full BMC TrueSight architecture in accordance with the number of applications and servers/network devices provided during the request for quote.  The solution will have redundant capabilities and will be deployed within ICE’s production environment.

U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS), a component of the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), is responsible for administering a variety of immigration benefits including permanent resident status, work permits, naturalization (citizenship), international adoptions, student visas, Temporary Protected Status, asylum, and refugee status. Applicants make a formal request to USCIS by filing an application with an established processing fee and appropriate documentation. USCIS provides applicants with immigration and related services to support the legal and regulatory requirements of the application process through ite headquarters, regional and district offices, service centers, and application support centers. Once an applicant is approved, the applicant is issued a document, All issued documents with the exception of the Naturalization Certificate have an expiration date. Applicants must re-apply at specified intervals to renew documents and coninue immigration benefits. One of USCIS' primary responsibilities is to administer and manage Application Support Centers (ASCs) and related operations. ASCs collect applicant biometric and biographical data (e.g. digital fingerprints, photographs, and signatures). the data is used to conduct criminal background checks prior to USCIS making a determination whether to grant immigration benefits to applicants. Additional support functions are likely as USCIS continues to grow and evolve. This procurement is a continuation of the Application Support Center (ASC) program established in 1997 which is currently under the Identity and Information Management Division (IIMD) within the USCIS Immigration Records and Identity Services (IRIS) Directorate of USCIS.

NAICS: 488999 - All Other Support Activities for Transportation
Description:
Transportation of Armored Vehicles from Washington, DC to various locations within the United States is required to meet the protection demands of the USSS. The transport carrier must have the ability to provide the following: 
 Provide transport within 18 hours notice. Transport vehicle must have covered trailer that can be secured and locked with a USSS padlock or seal.  Must be a covered step deck trailer with ramps. The trailer must measure 53 feet in overall length (or larger), with a mandatory 42 feet on the bottom deck.  Each trailer must be equipped with two sets of ramps (capable of the weight load per vehicle) and special tie downs (capable for the weight load per vehicle). Driver/s must be able to access a military base.  The driver will be required to obtain a Defense Biometric Identification System Card, if they do not already have one.  The vendor should supply a minimum 15 drivers that can meet the criteria to obtain the Defense Biometric Identification System Card. At no time will a person who: (1) is a registered sex offender, (2) has any warrant, (3) has an open felony conviction, (4) has a felony charge in the past ten years, be given approval for access.  Transport vehicle must not be left unattended at any point during transport. *At times this may require two drivers or more, that meet the security requirements, to ensure the vehicles are never left unattended.  Coordinate with the Government POC for pick-up and arrival times.  Delivery locations are throughout the continental United States.  A transport vehicle will provide shipping for two Armored Vehicles (weighing between 10,000-15,000 lbs. each) at a time.  At times, there will be shipments to four different locations in one week, and up to 8 shipments in one month, and the vendor must provide the ability to transport to these locations within 24 hour notice. Driver and/or company will ensure they provide all documentation (i.e. bill of lading) necessary for transportation from origination address and to the destination address.
